title: [K-12] Social-Emotional Learning (SEL) and Data-Informed Learning Design (DILD) Integrated Language Education Course for Pre-Service Teachers: Enhancing Text, Expression, and Reading Comprehension Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational general education knowledge, understanding of social-emotional learning (SEL) concepts, basic data interpretation skills, and introductory language education methodologies (including grammar, vocabulary, and reading instruction)
context.additional_context: Case-based practical curriculum combining text analysis/expression activities with data analytics to equip pre-service teachers with effective SEL (Social-Emotional Learning) integration in language instruction. Aims to simultaneously improve learners' reading comprehension, expressive skills, and socio-emotional growth, emphasizing activities with diverse text types (expository, argumentative, dialogic).

learning_goals: Learners can explain the five core competencies of SEL (self-awareness, self-management, social awareness, relationship skills, responsible decision-making) in connection with linguistic expression (speaking, writing, listening, reading)
Learners can comprehensively diagnose learners' socioemotional needs and language development levels (vocabulary, grammar, reading comprehension) by analyzing simple survey data
Learners can write an SEL-integrated language lesson design based on the DILD framework and design writing activities (text generation/revision) incorporating peer feedback
Learners can propose methods to implement SEL-related language education activities (e.g., role-playing, discussions, expressive activities) using only smartphones in offline environments

resources: SEL case study video (for smartphone playback)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
